gui

Class Game

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.awt.Component
      • java.awt.Container
        • javax.swing.JComponent
          • javax.swing.JPanel
            • gui.Game
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.awt.image.ImageObserver, java.awt.MenuContainer, java.io.Serializable, javax.accessibility.Accessible

    public class Game
extends javax.swing.JPanel
implements java.io.Serializable
    The main game panel. Displays pet and player info, and allows the player to interact with pets and visit the store.
    Author:
    Andrew Davidson (ada130), Alex Tompkins (ato47)
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

    • Constructor Detail

      • Game

        public Game(ToyType[] toyTypes,
            FoodType[] foodTypes,
            java.awt.Font titleFont,
            java.awt.Font subtitleFont,
            java.awt.Font boldFont,
            java.awt.Font semiBoldFont,
            java.awt.Font regularFont,
            RoundOverview roundOverview,
            java.awt.event.ActionListener exitToMainMenu,
            java.awt.event.ActionListener exitToDesktop)
        Create the panel - the panel that the main game is played in. Players can interact with pets and visit the store.
        Parameters:
        toyTypes - All toy types in the game
        foodTypes - All food types in the game
        titleFont - The font for the day heading
        subtitleFont - The font for subtitles
        boldFont - The font for subheadings
        semiBoldFont - The font for regular text
        regularFont - The font for fields and spinners
        roundOverview - A panel to display a round overview at the end of each round
        exitToMainMenu - An action listener that will exit to main menu on action
        exitToDesktop - An action listener that will exit to desktop on action

      • initialise

        public void initialise(Player[] players,
                       int numberOfDays,
                       int incomePerTurn)
        Initialise the game environment for a new game.
        Parameters:
        players - The players to participate in this new game
        numberOfDays - The number of days the game will go for
        incomePerTurn - The player's income per day in the game

      • resume

        public void resume(Game savedGame)
        Initialise the game from a saved game file.
        Parameters:
        foodTypes - The food types that were in the saved game
        toyTypes - The toy types that were in the saved game
        players - The players that were in the saved game
        currentDay - The day the saved game was at
        currentPlayerIndex - The player the saved game was at
        numberOfDays - The total number of days the saved game is to go for
        incomePerTurn - The income per turn for each player
        previousScores - The scores of the players for the previous round, used in round overview
